title: Lotito Extends Olive Branch to Lazio Fans, Suggests Stadio Flaminio for Euro 2032
description: Lazio patron Claudio Lotito unveiled the outlines of the Stadio Flaminio project in a special ceremony held at Formello on Tuesday morning.The BackgroundThe Biancocelesti have been keen on building th...
fullText:
Lazio patron Claudio Lotito unveiled the outlines of the Stadio Flaminio project in a special ceremony held at Formello on Tuesday morning.

The Biancocelesti have been keen on building their own stadium, and in recent years, they have identified the currently defunct Stadio Flaminio as the best viable solution. The Italian capital club presented a renovation project to the municipality of Rome, which received the initial approval of the mayor.

In recent days, Lazio sent their detailed project to the municipality along with the required documents, and they have now decided to share it with the public through a special presentation. As La Lazio Siamo Noi reports, Lotito was the first to take the stage, reading a prepared speech that began by explaining the importance of the project, not only for the club, but for the entire city.

Good morning everyone. I would like to thank the representatives of the institutions, the professionals who worked on the project, the media, and all those who chose to attend or connect through the various formats provided by our Media Company. Today we are not simply presenting a construction project. We are presenting a vision. The redevelopment of the Stadio Flaminio is not just about S.S. Lazio. It concerns Rome, its urban history and its ability to look to the future with responsibility. We are intervening in a context of great historical and architectural value, born with the 1960 Olympic Games. The Stadio Flaminio is not an isolated structure. It is part of an urban system with a long-established sporting and cultural vocation. Our objective is to regenerate an area that today shows clear signs of decline, restoring quality, functionality, sustainability and public safety.

The Lazio president insisted that the plan took into consideration various aspects, including the environment and the traffic jam in the construction area.

We have addressed the issue of mobility with seriousness, fully aware of residents‚Äô concerns. The project includes the relocation of parking facilities outside the neighbourhood, the strengthening of local public transport, incentives for pedestrian and cycle mobility, and the transformation of the area into an environmental island. On the environmental front, the intervention will lead to a significant increase in green spaces and tree coverage, with a green belt around the stadium and more than 57,000 square metres of innovative paving designed to help reduce pollutants. The project also includes specific technological solutions aimed at significantly reducing noise impact, in full respect of nearby homes and the surrounding urban fabric

We are ready for discussion. We are ready to listen. We are ready to explain every aspect of the proposal with transparency. Because a project of this importance cannot be imposed. It must be built with responsibility, respect for institutions and a long-term vision.

The under-fire president also opted to address the ongoing conflict between himself and the organized fan groups, who have been boycotting the club‚Äôs home games in an attempt to force him to sell the club. Lotito thus took the opportunity to explain himself and try to bury the hatchet.

Allow me a word for our supporters. I know the debate has been intense in recent months. I listen to every opinion, even when it is critical. My character‚Äîwhether for better or worse‚Äîsometimes leads me to speak very frankly. It can happen that certain statements are interpreted differently from how I intend them. But every decision I make is guided solely by the good of Lazio and always inspired by the heart. When the future of Lazio is discussed, emotions run high. And that is only right: passion is the soul of this club. But precisely because Lazio is passion, it must also be responsibility. This project is not meant to divide. It is meant to build something that will last. Every supporter dreams of a full, modern, identity-defining stadium. I dream of it too. But dreams must stand on the legs of sustainability, respect for the rules and economic balance. Lazio must grow without jeopardising what has been built in recent years: stability, solidity and continuity. Judge the project for what it is: an intervention that improves an area currently in decline, that brings green spaces, sustainable mobility and urban quality, and that gives Lazio a home consistent with its history.We can debate, compare views, even criticise. But let us not lose sight of the common objective: leaving Lazio and the entire city something solid and lasting.

Claudio Lotito (Photo by Marco Rosi ‚Äì SS Lazio/Getty Images)

The 68-year-old also teased the five-year club project titled ‚ÄòLazio 2032‚Äô, which will be unveiled in March.

During the next international break we will present ‚ÄúLazio 2032 ‚Äì The Responsible Dream‚Äù, a strategic conference outlining the club‚Äôs future path. On that occasion, together with the consulting firm Deloitte and LUISS University, we will illustrate a five-year industrial plan based on economic sustainability, asset growth and sporting competitiveness. The stadium is one piece of the puzzle, but the vision is broader.

Moreover, Lotito revealed his intention to have the Stadio Flaminio ready for Euro 2032, which will be hosted by Italy and Turkiye.

The choice of 2032 is no coincidence. It represents a timeframe consistent with European sporting trajectories and with the outlook linked to the European Championships. S.S. Lazio has already formally expressed its interest in having the Stadio Flaminio considered among the potential host venues. This is neither a promise nor a forced move. It is an act of responsibility and vision: placing Rome and the Flaminio in a position to take part in a major international event, should the technical and institutional requirements allow it. We are aware that the process of allocating venues will be competitive and that multiple bids are expected in our city. Precisely for this reason, we want to approach the matter with method, transparency and planning. ‚ÄúLazio 2032‚Äù will be an open forum with institutions, partners and supporters, aimed at building a serious and constructive dialogue about the club‚Äôs future and the role we intend to play for the city.

Finally, Lotito was asked how he intends to finance this project, and he insisted that it will be funded by the sponsors.

The stadium will be self-financed through sponsorships. We want a transparent discussion; this will be a facility that serves the community.

title: What time does Amber Glenn actually skate? Full schedule for women's figure skating short program on Tuesday
description: This is all you need to know.
fullText:
What time does Amber Glenn actually skate? Full schedule for women's figure skating short program on Tuesday originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Amber Glenn already has a gold medal at the 2026 Winter Olympics.

But that was in the team program for the United States star, and there's more to aim for in the individual competition.

The U.S. hasn't had a women's medalist as an individual since 2006, so Glenn and her teammates are carrying a burden to try and change that.

Glenn very well might be up to the task. She's well known, and she'll have plenty of fans rooting her on as she begins competition on Tuesday.

WATCH:¬†Women's figure skating LIVE on Peacock

First up is the short program. The score from that will be combined with the free skate, contested later in the week, to get a total score that determines who gets medals.

Action in the free skate for the women's competitors begins at 12:45 p.m. ET (6:45 p.m. local time) on Tuesday, but it'll be a while before Glenn is actually on the ice.

Amber Glenn will skate her short program at 4:46 p.m. ET (10:46 p.m. local time) on Tuesday in Italy.

She is the second-to-last competitor, with only Japan's Mone Chiba after her.

The skaters are broken up into five warm-up groups.

All three U.S. skaters are in the final group, including Alysa Liu (4:20 p.m. ET) and Isabeau Levito (4:27 p.m. ET).

title: 2026 Winter Olympics medal count, standings entering February 17
description: The 2026 Winter Olympics medal count is taking shape, with Norway pulling ahead at the top of the table at the Milan Cortina Games. Norway (28 total medals) has claimed an Olympic-high 12 gold medals to go with seven silver‚Ä¶
fullText:
The 2026 Winter Olympics medal count is taking shape, with Norway pulling ahead at the top of the table at the Milan Cortina Games. Norway (28 total medals) has claimed an Olympic-high 12 gold medals to go with seven silver and nine bronze.

Following Norway is Italy, with 23 overall medals (8 gold, 4 silver, and 11 bronze), while the United States rounds out the top three.

Team USA enters Tuesday with 19 total medals (6 gold, 8 silver, and 5 bronze).

MORE: 2026 Winter Olympics TV schedule, Milan Cortina events on today ‚Äì February 17

On Monday, Team USA added two more medals thanks to the women‚Äôs monobob bobsleigh event. Elana Meyers Taylor won gold, while Kaillie Armbruster Humphries claimed bronze in the same event.

Taylor, 41, officially became the oldest Olympian ever to win a gold medal in an individual event.

We will have to see whether Team USA can add to its medal count throughout the day on Tuesday.

title: Bahrain is a quiet power player on the horse-racing circuit
description: Dubai and Riyadh have much bigger prize pools, but Bahrain is quietly attracting mid-tier owners to its turf.
fullText:
Horse racing has an indelible footprint in the Arabian peninsula. Equestrianism is one of the most enduring cultural traditions, and the region‚Äôs most prominent sheikhs have long shaped European thoroughbred racing. So it was inevitable that Saudi Arabia‚Äôs renaissance would include a push into the global racing elite. And equally inevitable that it would do so with serious financial firepower.

From a debut during the pandemic in 2020, the Saudi Cup has sprinted out of the stalls to claim a top spot on the international calendar. At $30 million, it supplanted the Dubai World Cup ‚Äî which has a $20 million prize pool ‚Äî as the world‚Äôs richest race. The two-day February meeting doubles as a high-quality international contest and an attempt to create a fixture on Riyadh‚Äôs social calendar.

But under the radar, it‚Äôs perhaps the Bahrain Turf Club that has most effectively embedded itself into the Middle East circuit, and enhanced its relevance with the British horse racing industry.

The ties binding the equine worlds of the UK and Arabia date back to year zero for the sport. Every modern thoroughbred traces lineage to three stallions imported to Britain in the late 17th century: the Darley Arabian, the Godolphin Arabian, and the Byerley Turk. Bred with stronger British mares, these thoroughbreds define the sport.

Today, the money and dirt tracks of Riyadh provide a showcase for American and Japanese contenders, while Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid‚Äôs Godolphin outfit straddles world racing from its Meydan (UAE) and Newmarket (UK) bases. But in its fourth year, the Bahrain Turf Series ‚Äî under the stewardship of Shaikh Isa bin Salman bin Hamad Al Khalifa ‚Äî has opened up an easy pathway for international horses to compete, especially from UK stables more accustomed to grass than dirt.

British horse racing, renowned as the Sport of Kings, is under pressure. Prize pots have seen a precipitous decline, and those who run the sport seem always to be at war with the betting operators who pour a lot of money in. For some owners, the opportunity to compete in the fallow winter months in Bahrain has proved compelling.

Just 15 minutes from downtown Manama in Riffa, the doors to the Rashid Equestrian Club open up to unveil a circuit of perfect emerald grass, surrounded by desert. Racing takes place on Friday evenings, and some Thursdays, from October through the winter months.

Unlike the huge purses of Saudi and Dubai, Bahrain‚Äôs $1 million Turf Series targets international talent, trainers, and owners at the mid-range. The money on offer regularly attracts a who‚Äôs who of British racing. Sir Alex Ferguson has even enjoyed watching his horse win here. It‚Äôs not just a series benefitting tourist riders though. The current champion jockey is a Bahraini, Ebrahim Nader, who came up through the Bahrain Turf Club Academy.

Top British trainer George Baker stables his horses at home at Epsom Downs, practically in sight of the finish line of the 250-year-old Derby, probably still the most prestigious, if not lucrative race in the world. But proximity to the sport‚Äôs oldest traditions has not blinded him to the possibilities opening up in the Gulf. George Baker Racing has sent horses to compete annually in Bahrain since 2021.

‚ÄúThe Bahrain Turf Club has been clever in its approach,‚Äù Baker told me. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôve listened to participants and made their offering more appealing every year. From giving travel incentives for both horses and owners to the upgrade every season to their facilities. Over the four seasons of the Turf Series, the racing has become incredibly competitive.‚Äù

When I first visited in 2022, there was just a small grandstand. International visitors and owners socialized in the car parks; tailgate style, picnicking from the back of SUVs. The rest of the spectator area was teeming with Bahrainis and migrant workers. Mainly male, all transfixed by what was taking place on the turf. Scuffles have been known to break out near the track ‚Äî perhaps over money changing hands in unseen corners during each race.

Now upgraded, the grandstand facilities are as good as anything in international racing. Floodlights installed at the start of last season mean that races now take place in the evening cool. Local families mingle with expats, enjoying the views, food trucks, and action. The horse racing scene is evolving to become a second sporting attraction for Bahrain, following the kingdom‚Äôs top event, the Formula 1 Grand Prix in April.

And that, perhaps, is the real story. In a region where the biggest and most expensive dominate the conversation, smaller Gulf states are still finding niches for themselves. Bahrain can‚Äôt outspend its neighbors. What it can do is identify a gap in the calendar and build a complementary competition that benefits from the megaevents around it. The approach that has made the Turf Series a success has applications across industries ‚Äî targeting other forms of tourism rather than focusing solely on luxury, for example ‚Äî and could help the Gulf capture more of the markets it is competing in.

In 1906, American political cartoonist Homer Davenport, on a mission from President Theodore Roosevelt, traveled to Aleppo, Syria, to acquire Arabian horses for a US cavalry breeding program. The 27 mares and stallions he brought back are in the bloodline of almost all the 630,000-plus registered Arabians in the US today, Jane Waldron Grutz wrote in a 2011 edition of Aramco World magazine.

title: HSV celebrate hitting 1887 Bundesliga games with special-edition shirt
description: Hamburger SV have hit an extraordinary milestone, as the club have now played 1887 games in the Bundesliga ‚Äì the same number as the year the club was founded.¬†As only the seventh Bundesliga club to...
fullText:
Hamburger SV have hit an extraordinary milestone, as the club have now played 1887 games in the Bundesliga ‚Äì the same number as the year the club was founded.

As only the seventh Bundesliga club to reach this goal, HSV are releasing¬†a special-edition heritage-inspired jersey to mark the historic event.

Under the motto "Sturm und Glanz"¬†(Storm and Glory), the jersey is designed to honor both the glory-filled moments and tougher times that altogether have led¬†the club to where it is today.

The shirt features the classic white and blue¬†signature colors, with a dark-red crew neck and gold details. Most remarkable is the special 1887 print on the back, which you might want to take a closer look at.

The number at the back features the names of the 465 players who have represented HSV in the Bundesliga ‚Äì a way of honoring the players who made it possible for HSV to get to where they are today.

The design may be new, but the quality remains the same, and you can look forward to wearing¬†an Adidas shirt in 100% recycled polyester with moisture-absorbing AEROREADY¬†technology, making sure you don‚Äôt smell like you've just played 1887 matches.

The shirt already appears to be hugely popular among fans ‚Äì it has sold out in physical stores, while the online shop is currently down due to extremely high traffic

title: Referee La Penna reports death threats after Inter 3-2 Juventus mistake
description: Referee Federico La Penna has reported to the police and public prosecutor‚Äôs office after receiving multiple death threats in the aftermath of the Derby d‚ÄôItalia between Inter and Juventus in Seri...
fullText:
Referee Federico La Penna has reported to the police and public prosecutor‚Äôs office after receiving multiple death threats in the aftermath of the Derby d‚ÄôItalia between Inter and Juventus in Serie A over the weekend.

La Penna was the man in the middle for the fiery derby between Inter and Juventus in San Siro on Saturday evening. The game ended 3-2 in favour of the hosts, but the Bianconeri were left furious after Pierre Kalulu was wrongly sent off in the 42nd minute.

The Juventus defender was shown a yellow card in the 32nd minute for a foul on Nicolo Barella, which some deemed to have been harsh in the first place, and was then given his marching orders 10 minutes later for a supposed foul on Alessandro Bastoni. Replays confirmed that the Inter defender had dived in an attempt to get his opponent sent off.

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì FEBRUARY 14: Pierre Kalulu of Juventus reacts as he walks off after being sent off by Referee Federico La Penna (not pictured) for a second yellow card offence during the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and Juventus FC at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on February 14, 2026 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

As this was a second yellow card decision and not a straight red, VAR was not able to review the incident. For similar reasons, the sporting authorities will not be able to take retrospective action.

To add insult to injury for Juventus, Bastoni was also carrying a booking at the time of the incident and would have been sent off himself had the referee decided to book him for simulation.

Refereeing designator Gianluca Rocchi later admitted that a mistake was made during the Derby d‚ÄôItalia and said that La Penna was ‚Äòdistraught‚Äô with his error.

Now, according to reports from Corriere dello Sport, La Penna has had to report to the police and the public prosecutor‚Äôs office after receiving multiple death threats online in the days following the Derby d‚ÄôItalia. La Penna has reportedly received personal threats and threats to his family as well.

BOLOGNA, ITALY ‚Äì APRIL 13: Referee Federico La Penna reacts during the Serie A TIM match between Bologna FC and AC Monza at Stadio Renato Dall‚ÄôAra on April 13, 2024 in Bologna, Italy. (Photo by Alessandro Sabattini/Getty Images)

An investigation was immediately opened, the results of which are pending.

La Penna is not expected to be involved in any Serie A matches this coming weekend, but Tuesday‚Äôs report suggests that he could be back for the following round of fixtures, either as a fourth official or as a VAR.

title: Wasteful Barcelona must take accountability to get out of their current funk
description: The well has run dry for Hansi Flick and his players
fullText:
The word of the day in Barcelona is frustration.

This Girona game should have been put away in the first half, but that of course assumes Barcelona is able to put away their chances.

Lamine Yamal alone missed three point blank opportunities in the opening 45 minutes, one of which was a penalty.

When Barcelona finally took the lead behind a redemptive goal from Pau Cubars√≠, Girona pulled one back within minutes.

And again, because of course there was, we had referee controversy.

Jules Kounde lay on the floor at the top of the penalty area after being stomped on, and watched as Fran Beltr√°n slotted home the game winning goal. No whistle from the referee, and no VAR intervention.

This team can‚Äôt buy a break at the moment.

Hansi Flick will leave the game feeling a sense of consternation. His tactics continue to produce so much offense, 26 shots on the night against their Catalan rivals, and yet Barcelona are not in control of games.¬†In fact, Girona had the better chances on the night and should have scored more. In the end, they had nine shots on target, compared to just four for Barcelona.

Luckily, the Blaugrana will get a midweek break since they don‚Äôt have to play in the Champions League knockout playoff round.

They need physical rest, but they also need a mental break, and an official reset before the home stretch of the season begins.

Recall that this time last year, even though Barcelona went on to win the league and the Copa del Rey, their energy started to drop off as fatigue from the long campaign set in.

It won‚Äôt get any easier from here, but one thing that helps as an infusion of energy is scoring goals. Success begets success, as the mental can jumpstart the physical.

Barcelona can‚Äôt lose belief in themselves, but that‚Äôs the danger of where they‚Äôre at.

The tactics aren‚Äôt changing, and maybe that‚Äôs ok, so long as they find their finishing boots again.

Raphinha is back, and soon Pedri and Marcus Rashford will return to the lineup too. Even Gavi, who may have a role to play as someone who can bring much-needed intensity off the bench in critical moments.

The best path forward is to see the glass as half full.

You can draw a line from Girona to Real Sociedad, the last two league losses that have allowed Real Madrid to climb back into first place.

Barcelona must know that success is in their hands. They didn‚Äôt lose these two games to their opponents as much as they beat themselves. If they see it that way, it should give them hope going forward that they have the power to turn around their own fortunes.

As their best players return to action, so should Barcelona return to the best version of themselves, one that can outscore any rival on any given day.

If you‚Äôre hoping for pragmatism, keep dreaming.

Hansi Flick, so long as he‚Äôs the manager, knows only one way of playing, and for the most part, his attacking philosophy has brought Barcelona a lot of success.

There‚Äôs no time to make excuses, and nothing constructive will come from questioning the gameplan. There is lots of football to be played.

These players know the winning formula. They have it in them to do better.

There‚Äôs nothing to it but to stay positive and keep the foot on the gas.

title: Alejandro Balde: Man United explode into race for Barcelona star
description: Manchester United have charged into the race for FC Barcelona full-back Alejandro Balde in an explosive twist, according to a new report from Spain. Full-back or winger?The Red Devils are prioritising...
fullText:
Manchester United have charged into the race for FC Barcelona full-back Alejandro Balde in an explosive twist, according to a new report from Spain.

The Red Devils are prioritising a new option on the left-hand side, be it a left-back or left-winger, after the departure of Ruben Amorim.

INEOS sent shockwaves across Old Trafford after deciding to bring an end to the Portuguese coach‚Äôs tumultuous tenure last month ‚Äì with Michael Carrick arriving as caretaker in his place.

The 44-year-old Englishman immediately transitioned the side back to a 4-2-3-1 system, leaving behind the ill-equipped 3-4-2-1 Amorim had steadfastly sought to implement.

United are expected to maintain this set-up regardless of who is the head coach next season, with the search for Amorim‚Äôs long-term successor to be concluded over the summer. This reignites the need for more reinforcements on the left, however.

Patrick Dorgu has been reinvented in a more advanced role under Carrick, with only injury intervening to slow down his impressive form after back-to-back goals against Manchester City and Arsenal.

Where United envision the 21-year-old Dane playing in the long-term ‚Äì be it at full-back or on the wing ‚Äì will dictate what position is targeted this summer.

And if the latest report from Fichajes is to be believed, Dorgu should get used to his new berth further forward.

The Spanish outlet reveals United have ‚Äúentered the race‚Äù for the Barcelona left-back, whose outstanding speed and technical ability mean his best work often comes in the opposition half.

A bid worth around ‚Ç¨40 million is ‚Äúalready on the table‚Äù in an effort to prise the 22-year-old Spain international away.

However, Barcelona are understood to believe a larger fee can be demanded in negotiations, though there is acceptance that the ‚Äúoffer is attractive‚Äù as they solidify their summer plans.

The Blaugrana are facing financial difficulties ahead of an important transfer window in Catalonia. In fact, the club are uncertain whether to meet the ‚Ç¨30m buy-clause in Marcus Rashford‚Äôs loan deal from United.

This makes the prosect of an unexpected cash injection from the Old Trafford war chest a difficult one to turn down at the Camp Nou.

Balde is a flying full-back who operates best on the overlap. He would provide a perfect complement to the more defensive Luke Shaw, as well as the width required if an inverted player like Matheus Cunha is playing on the left, rather than Dorgu.

A ‚Ç¨40m (¬£35m) fee is a reasonable one for a target with Balde‚Äôs experience at the highest level of club and international football.

title: Fury to have no coach or nutritionist for comeback
description: Tyson Fury makes his return on 11 April and believes his inactivity could play a big role in his comeback.
fullText:
Tyson Fury claims he will have no trainer for his comeback fight against Arslanbek Makhmudov.

The two-time heavyweight world champion will come out of retirement on 11 April after a year-long spell away from boxing.

American coach SugarHill Steward has trained Fury since 2019, helping him reclaim the WBC world title and coached him in the two defeats by Oleksandr Usyk.

Speaking to the 5 Live Boxing podcast with Steve Bunce, Fury said he would "do it all" by himself for his comeback training camp.

"I don't need a trainer, I don't need a nutritionist, I don't need a mind coach, I don't need a sleep coach and I definitely don't need a strength coach," he said.

"Here's what I need in boxing - someone to wash my gumshield out and give me some water between rounds, and give me a smear of Vaseline across the eyes, and leave the rest to me.

Tyson Fury: Make Boxing Great Again

'I bring a circus' - ringmaster Fury in 'prime' for Makhmudov fight

Fury retired after successive defeats by former undisputed heavyweight champion Usyk.

The 37-year-old, who has 34 wins in 37 fights including one draw, was in vintage form at his first news conference since announcing his return on Tuesday in London.

He tickled his opponent Makhmudov during their face-off and said he wanted to "make boxing great again".

Fury intends to win a world title during his comeback and dismissed claims he might struggle to sell 60,000 tickets at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium alongside the unheralded Makhmudov.

The Morecambe fighter spent two-and-a-half years out of the ring in his twenties because of a doping ban and mental health problems, but returned in 2018 after losing over 50kg and became world champion again in 2020.

"I'm 37 years old, been inactive 16 months, which is a massive factor," he said.

"I did it before with three years out the ring but I was only 29. Now I'm an older person, a pensioner really."

He added: "I bring the X factor to this game and there's nobody else alive today that can and bring more X factor to boxing than Tyson Fury."

title: What Was Michael Jordan Doing With That Kid? Viral Daytona 500 Clip Is Raising Eyebrows
description: Michael Jordan has long been a force in basketball, but his role in NASCAR keeps drawing attention. On February 15, 2026, his team, 23XI Racing, ... Read More
fullText:
Michael Jordan has long been a force in basketball, but his role in NASCAR keeps drawing attention. On February 15, 2026, his team, 23XI Racing, claimed its first Daytona 500 win with driver Tyler Reddick crossing the finish line in a thrilling last-lap push.

The race, known as NASCAR's Super Bowl, took place at Daytona International Speedway, and Reddick's victory marked a major milestone for the team Jordan co-owns with Denny Hamlin. Reddick, behind the wheel of the No. 45 Toyota, edged out competitors in a dramatic finish that had fans on their feet.

The celebrations included Reddick's family, with his six-year-old son, Beau, joining the fun. Beau has been around the racing world since he was little, often spotted at events with his dad. The energy was high, with everyone laughing and toasting the achievement. Yet, amid all this excitement, one brief interaction caught the camera's eye and quickly shifted the conversation.

During the live broadcast, a short video captured Jordan standing near Beau in the crowded Victory Lane. The footage shows Jordan making repeated pinching motions at the lower back of the boy's shirt, as if tugging or adjusting it. He also briefly brushes or rubs the back of the child's leg. The moment lasts just seconds, but it happened amid the wet, messy aftermath of champagne and ice being thrown around.

üî•üö®BREAKING: This footage of NBA legend Michael Jordan engaging with a young NASCAR fan has been going viral on every social media network. pic.twitter.com/YINERdD5sY

‚Äî Dom Lucre | Breaker of Narratives (@dom_lucre) February 16, 2026

The clip spread fast across platforms like X, Instagram, and TikTok, racking up millions of views in hours. People shared slowed-down versions and screenshots, zooming in on Jordan's hands. Captions varied from questioning to outright accusatory, with some users labeling the actions as odd or out of place. The video's context shows a soaked shirt on Beau, hinting at the celebratory mess, but that detail got lost in many reposts.

This wasn't the first time a celebrity's public moment got dissected online, but Jordan's status as an icon amplified it. Fans who watched the full broadcast noted the chaos, with people bumping into each other and drinks flying. Still, the isolated clip took on a life of its own, prompting discussions about what exactly was happening in those few frames.

The video sparked strong reactions from viewers. Some expressed discomfort, calling the interaction inappropriate and demanding explanations. Comments included phrases like "error Jordan" or "not acceptable," reflecting frustration over perceived boundaries crossed in a public setting. Critics pointed out the optics, especially in a family-oriented event like the Daytona 500, where kids are often part of the festivities.

On the other side, supporters pushed back, arguing the moment was harmless and misunderstood. They highlighted how celebrations can involve playful gestures, and many suggested Jordan was simply trying to remove ice that had slipped under Beau's shirt from the ice buckets or sprays.

One user noted, "If you watch closely, the kid's shirt is wet, and MJ is just helping out like an uncle would." Defenders also brought up similar moments in sports where athletes roughhouse with kids in good fun, without ill intent.

The debate grew heated, with memes and videos circulating. Some compared it to past celebrity controversies, while others urged caution against jumping to conclusions based on a snippet. No formal complaints emerged from the Reddick family or NASCAR, and the clip remained more of a talking point than a scandal. Still, it highlighted how quickly public figures can face scrutiny in the age of viral content.

Jordan's connection to the Reddick family runs deep, adding layers to the story. Reddick joined 23XI Racing in 2023, and Jordan has built a bond with him and his loved ones over the years. In a 2024 interview, Reddick described Jordan as a mentor figure who interacts warmly with Beau, treating him like part of the extended team. Beau, born in 2019, has grown up around Jordan at races and team events, often sharing high-fives or chats.

Team representatives addressed the clip, stating Jordan was attempting to dislodge ice from the boy's shirt, a common occurrence in those wild celebrations. Reddick himself has spoken in the past about how Jordan's involvement boosts team morale, and their relationship extends beyond the track. For instance, Jordan has attended family milestones and offered advice on balancing racing with parenthood.

This familiarity explains why the moment might seem casual to those in the know. NASCAR culture emphasizes camaraderie, with owners, drivers, and families mingling closely. The Daytona win amplified that unity, but the viral clip pulled focus from the achievement.

As of now, Jordan hasn't commented publicly, and the buzz seems contained to online discussions. The incident serves as a reminder of how context matters in high-profile moments, especially when kids are involved.

title: ‚ÄòI feel like I‚Äôm in my prime still‚Äô: Tyson Fury geared up for Arslanbek Makhmudov fight
description: Tyson Fury says he‚Äôs back to make the sport great again.
fullText:
As Tyson Fury prepares for his latest return to boxing in an April fight against Arslanbek Makhmudov, the pair held an official press conference where Fury would explain what drove his desire to return to the sport once more and the selection of his opponent.

‚ÄúWhy did I come back to boxing? Very, very interesting question and there‚Äôs only one answer to that,‚Äù Fury said. ‚ÄúAnd the truth of the matter is I came back for one reason only, and that‚Äôs to make boxing great again. Since I retired for the fifth time over a year ago, boxing for me has gone on a downward slope. It‚Äôs become quite boring. And boxing is at its maximum potential when Tyson Fury is actively fighting ‚Äî and I didn‚Äôt say that, the cleverest AI on earth said that, ChatGPT.

‚ÄúAnd with my I brought back the biggest streaming platform on earth, Netflix‚Ä¶I bring a circus, I bring an entourage, I bring entertainment, I bring action, I bring cameras. I bring everything to the sport and it‚Äôs something that I‚Äôm so passionate about, that I love.

‚ÄúI was enjoying being retired‚Ä¶but it comes a point where you just want to go back to work. And my work will always be the fight game, no matter how old I am‚Ä¶I feel fresh, I feel good, and if I was on a decline I would say it. I‚Äôd be the first to say ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt got it no more‚Äô and I won‚Äôt box, but I don‚Äôt feel as if I‚Äôve lost anything. I feel like I‚Äôm in my prime still.

‚ÄúApril 11th can‚Äôt come soon enough. I‚Äôm in great shape, I‚Äôve been training since I‚Äôve retired ‚Äî I never stopped training, it‚Äôs apart of my hobby‚Ä¶Makhmudov, what do I know about him? I know he‚Äôs a giant. He‚Äôs bigger than he says he is. He says he‚Äôs 6‚Äô4‚Äù but I think he‚Äôs about 6‚Äô8‚Äù, he‚Äôs a big man‚Ä¶If I fight a pudding, I don‚Äôt get turned on by that. I have to fight somebody dangerous to make me even want to train, make me even want to take it seriously.‚Äú

title: Jasmine Paolini explains why Dubai feels ‚ÄòWeird‚Äô to play
description: Jasmine Paolini is looking to get her 2026 campaign going at the Dubai Tennis Championships, where she‚Äôll open against Alexandra Eala on Tuesday. Paolini has struggled to find rhythm early in the season, exiting in the third round of the Australian Open and then falling in her opening match at the Qatar Open.
fullText:
Jasmine Paolini is looking to get her 2026 campaign going at the Dubai Tennis Championships, where she‚Äôll open against Alexandra Eala on Tuesday.

Paolini has struggled to find rhythm early in the season, exiting in the third round of the Australian Open and then falling in her opening match at the Qatar Open.

Eala might be able to take advantage of those struggles when they meet on court.

Paolini will be hoping to find some of that form again when she takes on Eala.

The Dubai Tennis Championships return in 2026, and Jasmine Paolini‚Äôs already voiced some unusual feelings about playing there. She finds it strange how close fans are during matches, making it hard for her to settle into a rhythm.

‚ÄúIt feels a bit weird because I don‚Äôt like too much noise around,‚Äù she told SuperTennis. ‚ÄúNot even music because I can hear everything around.‚Äù

The proximity of fans isn‚Äôt new this year either; it‚Äôs been part of past events as well. Back in 2019, Halep had similar issues, pointing out that all courts are surrounded by stands with spectators positioned closely around them.

In 2024 Jasmine Paolini enjoyed a breakthrough year on the WTA Tour.

The Italian‚Äôs first significant tournament win came at the Dubai Tennis Championships. Paolini, unseeded at the event, defeated Beatriz Haddad Maia, Leylah Fernandez and Maria Sakkari on her way to the quarter-finals.

The Italian defeated Sorana Cirstea 6-2-7-6 in the semi-final setting up a clash with Anna Kalinskaya in the final.

title: Ranking the top 10 WWE men‚Äôs wrestlers ahead of the 2026 elimination chamber
description: Hello everybody, and welcome back to another week of the WWE‚Äôs Men‚Äôs Power Rankings. With only the Elimination Chamber between now and Wrestlemania, you can bet things are going to heat up once the superstars are set for the chamber.‚Ä¶
fullText:
Hello everybody, and welcome back to another week of the WWE‚Äôs Men‚Äôs Power Rankings. With only the Elimination Chamber between now and Wrestlemania, you can bet things are going to heat up once the superstars are set for the chamber. For now, let‚Äôs run through the list and get you caught up on some of the most recent storylines. Have a great day, everyone, and may the slams be with you.

MORE: 2026 Winter Olympics star compares muscles with NFL running back Saquon Barkley

‚ÄúThe Maverick‚Äù Logan Paul had another strong showing at the Royal Rumble. He looked great as always and even made it close to the end, showing that the WWE really loves his skill set. Even though Paul lost his chance to get into the Elimination Chamber last week, you can count on him getting another chance soon enough.

L.A. Knight returns to the list with his recent push and the injury to Bron Breakker, which has kept Breakker out indefinitely. On RAW last week, Knight defeated Penta and Austin Theory in a qualifying match for the Elimination Chamber. Now that the Megastar is back in the picture, you can expect the next two months to be fire. YEAH!

Instead of putting up his belt this week, Carmelo Hayes teamed up with Matt Cardona, Apollo Crews, and Ilia Dragunov against Solo Sikoa and the MFTs. In a match that was chaotic at times, the faces quickly found out why people avoid the MFTs by losing the match. I‚Äôm sure this week on SmackDown sounds good because now we have a big feud starting with a champion in the middle of it.

Dominik Mysterio has been limited due to the current storylines the WWE is pushing. However, last week on RAW, Mysterio finally returned to the WWE, which sets up nicely for the Elimination Chamber. I wouldn‚Äôt mind seeing the Intercontinental Championship put up for grabs in an Elimination Chamber, but that‚Äôs unlikely to happen right now, given the current storylines going on in the WWE.

Gunther defeated A.J. Styles in a retirement match for Styles at the Royal Rumble. Since then, he‚Äôs been trolling Styles, most recently by coming out to this entrance. This led to a fight after Dragon Lee came out once Gunther started talking badly about the WWE Universe. Since then, Gunther had been cutting promos, but I‚Äôm sure he‚Äôll be back to his cunning ways this week.

Jey and Jimmy Uso defended their WWE Tag Team Championships against the Alpha Academy on RAW last week. In a closely contested match, the Usos were able to survive a late surge by Tozawa to retain their championships after hitting the 1-D to pin Otis. YEET!

Roman Reigns made his triumphant return to RAW two weeks after winning the Royal Rumble. After asking the WWE to acknowledge him, C.M. Punk came out to go back and forth with Reigns, which led to Reigns choosing Punk as his Wrestlemania opponent. For now, Reigns will take a break from action, making him a must-see attraction for the WWE.

Drew McIntyre has continued his path of destruction by showing up during Rhodes‚Äô triple-threat match last week on SmackDown. Even though he didn‚Äôt inject himself into the matchup, Rhodes couldn‚Äôt contain himself and attacked McIntyre anyway. This didn‚Äôt change the fact that Rhodes still won, but during the show, McIntyre ran into Trick Williams, whom he warned to stay out of his way.

Cody Rhodes was part of a triple-threat match between Jacob Fatu, Sami Zayn, and himself. Drew McIntyre did come out during this match, in which Rhodes did go after him. Regardless, through all of the shenanigans, Rhodes came out victorious, cashing his ticket in for the Elimination Chamber.

C.M. Punk came out to do a promo with Michael Cole, but that was short-lived once Finn Bal√≥r came out. Bal√≥r demanded a rematch at Elimination Chamber in Chicago, in which Punk accepted. After that, Punk then addressed Roman Reigns and reassured everyone that he isn‚Äôt worried about taking a title match before his match with Reigns at Wrestlemania.

title: What Tudor must do to win over 'increasingly apathetic fanbase'
description: Is hiring Igor Tudor a stroke of genius or a disastrous appointment by the board?  On the one hand, the Croat has a reasonably impressive track record of improving teams over a short-term period.  Ultimately, as long as Tudor can do enough to keep us in the Premier League, I am not particularly fussed.
fullText:
Is hiring Igor Tudor a stroke of genius or a disastrous appointment by the board?

The fact that no-one seems able to answer this question with any great conviction has done nothing to either calm my nerves or excite me.

On the one hand, the Croat has a reasonably impressive track record of improving teams over a short-term period. Essentially, this is all we really need from him so we can avoid relegation, before we appoint a permanent head coach in the summer.

However, Tudor is also known for his high-intensity style of play, with training sessions and fitness work testing players to their limits.

Normally this would not concern me, but given our current injury crisis and ongoing issues within our medical department, I am not sure the ghost of Antonio Conte past is the wisest approach right now.

Ultimately, as long as Tudor can do enough to keep us in the Premier League, I am not particularly fussed.

However, therein lies the problem.

As a fan, I was excited to see who the board would call upon to rescue our season.

I appreciate the options were limited, given we needed someone who was available on a short-term basis mid-season, but this was also a priceless opportunity to unite an increasingly apathetic fanbase.

If we are to play our part in redeeming this season, we need to feel invested in our team.

Hopefully Tudor can win us over by inspiring ‚Äì or scaring ‚Äì the players into delivering something we have been missing so far in this campaign: football that is worth watching.

Get us scoring some goals, winning some games, and keep us in the league.

Then we can bring home everyone's favourite Argentine in the summer and forget this sorry season ever happened.

Find more from Ali Speechly at Women Of The Lane and on Instagram

title: 3 Explosive Reasons To Watch ONE Friday Fights 143 On February 20
description: Here's why you shouldn't miss this Asian primetime card at Lumpinee Stadium on February 20.
fullText:
ONE Championship continues its surging 2026 campaign with ONE Friday Fights 143 on February 20, another stacked card designed to thrill fans from the opening bell to the final horn.

Broadcasting live in Asia primetime from Bangkok‚Äôs iconic Lumpinee Stadium, this showcase features explosive Muay Thai and kickboxing battles that promise non-stop action and career-defining moments.

International stars look to cement their cases for a life-changing US$100,000 contract, while some aim to reignite their campaigns with statement performances.

Before the opening bell rings inside the Madison Square Garden of the East, here are three reasons why ONE Friday Fights 143 demands your attention.

Israeli slugger Shir Cohen returns to the ring in search of her fourth consecutive victory, and another dominant performance could position her for a shot at ONE Championship gold.

The 25-year-old Fairtex Training Center representative has looked nothing short of spectacular throughout her promotional journey. She‚Äôs gone a perfect 3-0 with performances that have showcased her evolution as a complete striker, blending technical precision with devastating power that‚Äôs made her one of the most dangerous women in the division.

The timing couldn‚Äôt be better for the Israeli slugger to make her statement, as the ONE Women‚Äôs Atomweight Muay Thai World Title is set to be contested when divisional queen Allycia Hellen Rodrigues faces ‚ÄúThe Queen‚Äù Phetjeeja in the main event of ONE Fight Night 41 on Prime Video.

A fourth straight victory would make Cohen‚Äôs case undeniable and put her on the doorstep of the biggest opportunity of her career once more after an injury forced her to withdraw from her World Title fight against Rodrigues in June last year. However, standing in her path to title contention is one of Myanmar‚Äôs most dangerous striking exports, Vero.

The 29-year-old veteran enters this atomweight Muay Thai showdown at ONE Friday Fights 143 riding momentum from back-to-back victories over Junior Fairtex and Li ‚ÄúMiracle Girl‚Äù Mingrui. She brings veteran savvy, proven finishing ability, and experience ‚Äì exactly the type of test Cohen needs to pass to continue her ascent.

Vero possesses the tools to derail the Israeli‚Äôs momentum and inject herself into the ONE World Title picture with an upset victory. But no one has been able to slow down the Fairtex Training Center warrior thus far, and she‚Äôll look to keep that plot intact in this must-watch showdown.

Thai dynamo Anon Taladkondernmuangpon has wasted zero time making an impact since arriving at ONE, building a 2-0 resume on two ferocious finishes. He returns to Lumpinee looking to make it three straight finishes and strengthen his case for the US$100,000 contract and a spot on the main roster.

He needed just two rounds to demolish Samsiblan Sor Sasawat at ONE Friday Fights 115. Then, three months later, he gave Belgian finishing machine Gianny ‚ÄúThe Lion of Flanders‚Äù De Leu a taste of his own medicine with another second-round knockout to move to 82-20 in his career.

The N&P Boxing Gym affiliate combines technical precision with devastating power, making him one of the most exciting fighters in the division. However, Teeyai Torfunfarm, a battle-tested veteran, enters this strawweight Muay Thai tilt hungry for redemption.

The Thai striker sits on a three-fight losing streak, but dismissing him would be a critical mistake. Teeyai opened his ONE Championship tenure with back-to-back highlight-reel victories that showcased exactly the type of finishing power that could derail Anon‚Äôs perfect run on the global stage.

Knockout power exists on both sides, making this a high-risk, high-reward encounter for both men. Anon seeks to maintain perfection and edge closer to his contract, while Teeyai aims to play spoiler and return to winning ways inside Lumpinee.

When two strikers with proven finishing ability meet under these circumstances, the only guarantee is that someone‚Äôs night will end early.

Nakrob Fairtex and Panrit Lukjaomaesaiwaree collide in a bantamweight Muay Thai showdown that has barnburner written all over it.

Between them, these two veterans have accumulated 27 promotional appearances, and if there‚Äôs one guarantee, it‚Äôs that they‚Äôve consistently delivered value for every second of screen time.

Already contracted Nakrob has built his reputation on thrilling three-round wars and spectacular knockouts throughout his campaign in the world‚Äôs largest martial arts organization.

Panrit is no different. The Superbon Training Camp slugger has emerged victorious inside the distance with his dangerous match-finishing power. The 29-year-old has looked equally solid in several fights that went down to the wire.

For Nakrob, this represents another opportunity to showcase why he‚Äôs already earned his spot on ONE Championship‚Äôs main roster. On Panrit‚Äôs end, the stakes couldn‚Äôt be higher: an impressive victory over a contracted athlete would dramatically strengthen his case for the life-changing six-figure contract that remains just out of reach.

As such, for as long as this clash lasts expect fireworks, drama, and the type of all-action war that could steal the show when the organization returns to the Thai capital with another blockbuster ONE Friday Fights card on February 20.

title: PREVIEW: Benfica look to surprise Real Madrid again in playoff round first leg
description: Real Madrid visit Benfica for the first leg of the Champions League playoff round just weeks after the Portuguese side‚Äôs surprise victory denied Los Blancos automatic qualification to the round of 1...
fullText:
Real Madrid visit Benfica for the first leg of the Champions League playoff round just weeks after the Portuguese side‚Äôs surprise victory denied Los Blancos automatic qualification to the round of 16 at the Estadio da Luz.

The hosts made the playoffs on goal difference after finishing 24th in the league phase, courtesy of their barnstorming 4-2 win over Madrid with goalkeeper Anatoliy Trubin heading home in the dying minutes to close out a classic.

With three wins and five losses in eight games, Jose Mourinho‚Äôs side have been inconsistent but have shown just enough quality to stay in the competition and have gone unbeaten in their last five league outings, winning four.

Their latest encouraging result, a 2-1 win at Santa Clara, has given the team a confidence boost before this important match.

The home crowd could give Benfica a genuine advantage with the energy they bring, while √Ålvaro Arbeloa‚Äôs Madrid have sometimes struggled away in Europe.

Benfica scored 10 goals and conceded 12 in the league phase, showing they‚Äôve attacked well but are leaky in defense ‚Äì all of their last five Champions League games have ended with a winner, so draws are rare for them.

But the triumph over Madrid in the final round of the league phase for As √Åguias was their best moment in Europe this season, proving they can take advantage of the top team‚Äôs defensive weaknesses and be competitive.

They will try to repeat that performance and get a good result in the first leg.

Benfica might be missing several players, with Alexander Bah back in training after a long knee injury, but he may not be ready yet.

Samuel Soares could miss the game with a muscle problem, and Fredrik Aursnes is also expected to be out.

Joao Veloso‚Äôs condition remains uncertain, and even though Richard Rios has returned to training after a shoulder injury, he probably will not play.

Much like their opponents, Madrid arrive in Lisbon in a confident mood given their form in La Liga ‚Äì picking up four of their last five games, including a 4-1 win over Real Sociedad where Vin√≠cius J√∫nior bagged a brace.

However, their European campaign has been tougher. Madrid finished ninth with 15 points from eight games, winning five and losing three.

And two wins and three losses in their last five Champions League games is below their usual standard.

Madrid‚Äôs earlier loss to Benfica showed their defensive issues on the transition, which Arbeloa‚Äôs team need to keep in mind if they are to avoid a repeat of their damaging loss three weeks ago.

Arbeloa could employ a more careful approach in Lisbon, aiming to exact more control on the tie ‚Äì especially with so much at stake.

When teams are evenly matched, their ability to control the game and make the most of key moments can be decisive.

If Benfica leave gaps in defense, Madrid ‚Äì who often do well in high-pressure matches like this ‚Äì have the quality to exploit them and possibly take charge before the second leg.

Kylian Mbapp√©, who missed the win over Sociedad, is now fit and could play, but Raul Asencio is suspended after being shown a second yellow card in the final league phase clash.

Rodrygo is also suspended, having been handed a two-match ban handed out by UEFA for directing ‚Äúinsulting and abusive language‚Äù at the match officials, a costly mistake that means he will miss both legs of the play-off.

Madrid are also without England international Jude Bellingham, who is out with a hamstring injury, and Eder Militao is still recovering from a tendon problem.

title: Surprising day jobs of 15 American Olympians
description: When people picture Olympians, they often imagine full-time athletes whose lives revolve entirely around training, travel, and competition. The reality, however, is far more complex ‚Äî and often far more relatable. For many American Olympians, elite sport does not come‚Ä¶
fullText:
When people picture Olympians, they often imagine full-time athletes whose lives revolve entirely around training, travel, and competition. The reality, however, is far more complex ‚Äî and often far more relatable. For many American Olympians, elite sport does not come with the kind of financial stability people assume. Sponsorships can be limited, prize money inconsistent, and training expenses constant. As a result, many athletes build parallel careers that look surprisingly ordinary ‚Äî or, in some cases, completely unexpected.

Some balance technical professions that demand intense mental focus, while others work hands-on jobs that require physical endurance very different from their sport. A few take on roles connected to their athletic world, but many step into industries that seem worlds away from Olympic arenas. From engineering labs and finance offices to artistic studios and equipment workshops, these day jobs reveal a side of Olympians rarely seen during televised competitions.

What makes these stories compelling is not just the contrast, but the discipline required to sustain both worlds at once. Training schedules, recovery routines, and international travel must coexist with deadlines, customers, and professional responsibilities. In many cases, these careers are not temporary stopgaps but meaningful pursuits that provide stability, identity, and long-term direction beyond sport.

Looking at the surprising day jobs of 15 American Olympians offers a powerful reminder: behind the extraordinary performances are individuals navigating very practical realities ‚Äî working professionals who chase excellence both on the clock and on the world stage.

Ryan Cochran-Siegle helps run his family‚Äôs maple syrup farm in Vermont when he‚Äôs not racing down mountains. The physical, hands-on nature of farm work mirrors the endurance and discipline he needs in alpine skiing. It‚Äôs a grounded lifestyle that keeps him connected to family traditions even while competing on the world stage.

Korey Dropkin works in real estate, helping clients buy and sell homes while also competing internationally in curling. He‚Äôs described juggling two full-time commitments ‚Äî negotiating deals off the ice and chasing medals on it. The flexibility of real estate makes it one of the few careers that can adapt to Olympic-level travel.

Cory Thiesse works in a wastewater testing lab, analyzing chemicals as part of environmental monitoring. Her scientific job provides stability and helps fund her training schedule. Balancing precision in lab work with precision on the curling sheet shows just how structured her daily life must be.

Park City's Paige Jones ski jumps in mixed team at the Milano Cortina Olympics https://t.co/DHb1ctesFQ pic.twitter.com/ymsMhCMEjE

‚Äî TownLift (@TownLiftNews) February 13, 2026

Paige Jones is pursuing a degree in biomedical engineering alongside Olympic ski jumping. She has said academics help her mentally reset from the intense focus of competition. Her studies also hint at a long-term career path beyond sport, showing how Olympians often prepare for life after the Games.

Morelle McCane has worked several jobs, including performing as a children‚Äôs birthday party clown. It‚Äôs a striking contrast to her fierce persona in the boxing ring. The mix of gigs reflects the hustle many athletes rely on to finance their Olympic dreams.

Bradley Wilson sells artwork to help pay for his skiing career. What began as a creative hobby during the offseason turned into a genuine income stream. His artistic side offers both financial support and a mental break from the intensity of competition.

Chris Plys runs his late father‚Äôs food brokerage business while competing in curling. Managing a company requires leadership and decision-making ‚Äî skills that translate well to high-pressure matches. His dual role shows how family responsibilities and elite sport often overlap.

Lea Ann Parsley works as a firefighter, a job that demands strength, composure, and quick reactions. Those same qualities are essential in skeleton racing, where split-second decisions matter. Her career embodies a literal commitment to service both on and off the track.

Susan Dunklee works in environmental science, focusing on issues related to conservation and ecology. Her profession aligns naturally with her outdoor sport, which depends on pristine winter landscapes. It reflects a personal investment in protecting the environments where she trains and competes.

Tabitha Peterson works in pharmacy, helping patients manage medications and health care needs. The attention to detail required in dispensing prescriptions mirrors the precision of elite curling. Her medical career provides both financial security and meaningful work beyond sport.

Tara Peterson practices dentistry while competing internationally. The technical skill and steady hands needed in dental work parallel the control required in curling strategy and delivery. Her career shows how athletes can maintain highly specialized professions alongside elite competition.

Alex Deibold works as a snowboard wax technician, preparing boards so they perform optimally in changing snow conditions. The job keeps him deeply connected to the technical side of the sport, even when he‚Äôs not competing. His expertise with equipment gives him an insider‚Äôs understanding of performance that many athletes never fully develop.

Kimi Goetz works part-time as a processor at a finance company, handling paperwork and transactions between training sessions. The role demands accuracy and focus ‚Äî skills that translate directly to the precision required in elite speed skating. Her office work helps provide steady income while she pursues competition at the highest level.

Keely Cashman works as a barista at her family‚Äôs coffee shop. The job keeps her grounded in everyday routines when she‚Äôs not racing internationally. It‚Äôs a reminder that even elite athletes often return to ordinary work between competitions.

Austin Florian works as an aerospace engineer, applying advanced physics and engineering principles in a highly technical professional environment. His analytical mindset and problem-solving skills mirror the precision and control required in skeleton racing. Balancing a demanding STEM career with Olympic training highlights the intellectual and physical discipline he maintains year-round.

These athletes remind us that Olympic greatness doesn‚Äôt exist in isolation from everyday life. Their day jobs reveal resilience, adaptability, and determination that extend far beyond competition. Whether managing businesses, working technical roles, or supporting communities, they embody the idea that excellence can thrive in multiple arenas at once. Their stories make the Olympic journey feel not just inspiring, but deeply human.

title: Galatasaray vs Juventus ‚Äì Predicted lineup and team news
description: Galatasaray take on Juventus in the first leg of their Champions League play-off tie tonight.The Turkish champions are into the competition‚Äôs knockout rounds for the first time in over a decade and ...
fullText:
Galatasaray take on Juventus in the first leg of their Champions League play-off tie tonight.

The Turkish champions are into the competition‚Äôs knockout rounds for the first time in over a decade and face a glamour tie against the Italian giants.

Galatasaray head into the contest in good form after four consecutive wins, including a 5-1 thrashing of Eyupspor on Friday. Mauro Icardi hit a hat-trick in that fixture.

Mario Lemina will miss the clash against his former team through suspension, leaving a gap in the Galatasaray midfield. Head coach Okan Buruk could opt to reinstate Gabriel Sara, or unleash in-form forwards Icardi and Victor Osimhen as a pair in Istanbul.

Icardi and Osimhen have each scored 15 goals in all competitions this season, with the latter netting six in the Champions League alone.

There‚Äôs further flair in the form of Leroy Sane, who has recently returned to training after injury, and January recruits Noa Lang and Yaser Asprilla. Sacha Boey also returned to the club for a second spell in the winter window, on loan from German giants Bayern Munich.

Galatasaray remain without¬†Metahan Baltaci, who is banned due to his involvement in a Turkish betting scandal.

Galatasaray predicted XI: Cakir; Sallai, Bardakci, Sanchez, Jakobs; Yilmaz, Torreira, Gundogan, Lang; Icardi, Osimhen.

Galatasaray vs Juventus will kick-off in Istanbul at 17:45 GMT.

The Galatasaray v Juventus game will be shown live in the UK on TNT Sports 1.
